data.title: Great Northern Italian Dining.
data.text: One of the very best places for Italian food in Reno. Consistent high quality and service at this wonderful restaurant in this #1 hotel casino..

data.title: Vacation travel
data.text: Our favorite place to eat in Reno with wonderful food and great service.d  There is an extensive wine list.

data.title: Half Price Entree with Show Makes it Worthwhile
data.text: We went to La Strada as part of Eldorado's "Big Night Out," which involves buying a full price ticket for a show, entitling each ticket holder half off an entree at any restaurant at the casino. We started out with a combination of mushroom ravioli and shrimp wrapped in prosciutto. The combination plate of the 2 popular starters was not on the menu, but suggested by the waiter. The mushroom ravioli were, as other reviewers have stated, really delicious. The shrimp were good, but not sensational. I got veal osso buco, which was very tender and tasty, but it was served on a very rich, cheesy risotto, which became cloying after a few forkfuls. I think it would be better if it had been combined with a different side. My husband got tiny veal chops Milanese, which I think was breaded too heavily, and also chewy. The taste was good, though. His sides of carrots and potatoes were very good. We shared creme brulee for dessert, which was fine. I was disappointed in the bread served at the table. Coming from the east coast, and also having dined in Florence and Rome, I found the bread not crusty enough, and too soft. La Strada should find a new supplier, with more authentic Italian bread.

data.title: Awesome Food and Fabulous Service
data.text:
The menu here never disappoints.  They are famous for their mushroom ravioli and for good reason!  The restaurant is a bit pricey, but you definitely get what you pay for.
Great wine list, appetizers and desserts.  Too lengthy to list here.

data.title: Great food you get what you pay for and a little more, enjoy
data.text: A little on the expensive side by if you are looking for a place for a special time or event ,this is the place, been their a  time and all ways have received a special meal and way above average service by the staff. If in Reno a must place to try, enjoy!

data.title: Lovely "Before the Show" dinner
data.text: If you buy a ticket to their stage show El Dorado offers 50% off at its restaurants the night of the show.  We chose La Strada since it had been recommended to us.  The ambiance is cozy and the service was wonderful.  The 3 of us ordered 2 appetizers and 3 entrees to share.  My risotto was perfect & the seafood linguini was exceptional.  We didn't have time for dessert but will surely return to sample what looked like a tasty menu.  Our waiter was prompt, friendly, and very gracious to notice our tickets.  Absolutely no attitude about offering us the discount so we tipped him well.

data.title: A Taste of Italy
data.text: We started our evening at the Cin Cin bar for happy hour. It was very busy due to the pre-theater dinner crowd. The Martini was very good and reasonable. The restaurant was also packed with the theater crowd. Definitely recommend reservations. We received a very cheerful and warm welcome by the Maitre D', Amanda. My wife and I both ordered the linguini with clams. Both dishes had two dozen clams that were tender and without sand. The pasta was perfectly cooked. The wine selection was adequate and quite reasonable.  Even thought the restaurant was very busy and the kitchen was backed up, our waiter, Christopher made sure we were well taken care of and kept us informed of the progress of our meal. Overall a very pleasant experience.

data.title: loved it!  great food.
data.text: Super friendly helpful staff, they squeezed me in on a packed night.. Do not miss the ravioli appetizer!! Was amazing all by itself. The chicken marsala entree was fantastic as was the salad. the server was an older gentleman who was very knowledgeable and had some great recommendations . Overall an amazing meal and I will def.  return to dine there.

data.title: Amazing mushroom ravioli!
data.text: Happy hour 4:30-6:30 in Cin Cin bar...great value and food!  Had the homemade mushroom ravioli which melts in your mouth!  So good!  Thanks for the recommendation Nick!

data.title: Delicious
data.text: I didn't even remember eating here on a prior trip to Reno...anyways this visit was one of the best meals we have had in Reno this time around.  The lamb chops and osso buco were outstanding dishes!  I am sad that I couldn't finish all of my osso buco.  I would highly recommend this restaurant for a romantic night out or just a meal with good friends.  Staff was busy but attentive, but please make sure that every table has an oil & vinegar bottle etc.  It's the little things that count.

data.title: Great Salad bar with each entree
data.text: High end, but still large portions. The salad bar is fabulous. Worth coming back just for the soup and salad. Limited menu but all is good.

data.title: Entertaining bar staff
data.text: Had drinks and two appetizers here. The bruschetta topping was too complex with sweetly marinated eggplant--not to mt taste although my husband liked it. The antipasti was miserly in the amount of food although it tasted good. The bar staff were extremely friendly and entertaining. We will back for them!

data.title: somewhat disappointing
data.text:
After reading reviews and seeing it rated as one of the top ten Italian restaurants in the country, I was looking forward to something special.
I ordered the famed mushroom ravioli and my husband, the osso bucco.
We shared the dishes.  The ravioli were quite good but the white sauce was thick, rich and overpowered the ravioli.  I had never been served anything like that anywhere in Italy even though our server said it was an old family recipe.
I asked for a plate of plain arugula to cut the fatty taste and clear the palette.  I was charged $9 for that!
The osso bucco while a generous cut, was nothing outstanding.
We had no drinks, no appetizers, no dessert...our final tab was $72.  I would not return.

owner_response.author: P_Campitelli, F & B Coordinator at La Strada, responded to this review
owner_response.text:
Valued Guest,

Thank you very much for taking the time to leave your comments in regards to your dining experience. We work hard to offer exceptional food as well as outstanding service and I want to apologize that in this instance, we fell short. I will be sure to pass your feedback on to our entire team as we are  constantly using this to improve our services for our guests, such as yourself. We hope that you will give us another chance in the future to host you to a true "five star" dining experience.
owner_response.title: Owner Response

data.title: Upscale Italian
data.text: Very good Italian restaurant.  It was so close to being excellent.  Just a few minor things here and there kept it from being one of the best meals I've ever had.

data.title: Outstanding!
data.text:
You will not be disappointed if you dine at this lovely restaurant. 
The food and service are wonderful and the atmosphere is romantic and beautiful. 
Be sure and order the signature dish, mushroom  ravioli, it is to die for! This will be our go to restaurant any time we are in the area. Outstanding!

data.title: Nice place ... good wine list ... can get a bit noisy
data.text: We visited La Strada for dinner recently.  We had not dined at this restaurant before.  The place is very clean and well lighted.  They have a nice menu with a mix of Italian cuisine and seafood.

data.title: Mrs
data.text:
We had dinner in La Strada before going to a show. What a treat. I had Ossobuco, my husband had Veal Picatta both were delicious. But when they brought me the Tiramisu (pick me up) I thought I die and went to heaven. It was a good size piece and a great touch of some gelato on the side and berries.
The service from the hostess on was fantastic. Definitely a place to go.

data.title: A wonderful experience
data.text: We're seniors who enjoy fine food and service, and we found it here. Seating with our reservation was prompt and professional at a roomy table in comfortable chair in a nice setting. The restaurant was quite busy, but service was not slow. Our appetizers were the prosciutto wrapped shrimp and the Mediterranean salad with watermelon. Both were excellent. Our two entrees were veal marsala and veal saltimbocca, also perfect and accompanied by vegetables that were appropriate and properly done. With a bottle of wine and with terrific table service by Hannah,a young, attractive very well trained and caring pro, we were unrushed and left sated, delighted and smiling. We wished we lived here so we could come frequently. With the wine and a shared dessert, not cheap, about $135 plus tip, but we felt it was worth every penny compared to other top places. (And by the way, the complementary bread was also delicious.)

data.title: Great Italian dishes
data.text: We had eaten here quite a few times, but first time for our friends.  We all had different Veal dishes which were excellent.  Lots of food, and Veal was so good you could cut it with a fork.  If you want excellent Italian food, try this restaurant, you will not be disappointed.

data.title: Wonderful Food!
data.text: La Strada is hidden away in the El Dorado hotel and casino. It has wonderful food and an amazing atmosphere. Saying that the food is superb would be an understatement. I highly recommend this for anyone in the area. We have had dinner here many times before seeing a show at the El Dorado. I always love the mushroom ravioli at this restaurant.
